properties.name: Minaret and Archaeological Remains of Jam
properties.description: Rising in the Ghur province, this 65m-tall minaret was built in the 12th century.

properties.name: Cultural Landscape and Archaeological Remains of the Bamiyan Valley
properties.description: The cultural landscape and archaeological remains of the Bamiyan Valley represent the artistic and religious developments which from the 1st to the 13th centuries characterized ancient Bakhtria.

properties.name: Natural and Cultural Heritage of the Ohrid region
properties.description: Lake Ohrid is a superlative natural phenomenon, providing refuge for numerous endemic species of freshwater fauna and flora dating from the tertiary period.

properties.name: Butrint
properties.description: Inhabited since prehistoric times, Butrint has been the site of a Greek colony, a Roman city and a bishopric.

properties.name: Al Qal'a of Beni Hammad
properties.description: In a mountainous site of extraordinary beauty, the ruins of the first capital of the Hammadid emirs.

properties.name: Tassili n'Ajjer
properties.description: Located in a strange lunar landscape of great geological interest, this site has one of the most important groupings of prehistoric cave art in the world.

properties.name: M'Zab Valley
properties.description: A traditional human habitat, created in the 10th century by the Ibadites around their five ksour (fortified cities).

properties.name: Djémila
properties.description: Situated 900m above sea-level, Djémila, or Cuicul, with its forum, temples, basilicas, triumphal arches and houses, is an interesting example of Roman town planning.

properties.name: Tipasa
properties.description: On the shores of the Mediterranean, Tipasa was an ancient Punic trading-post conquered by Rome and turned into a strategic base for the conquest of the kingdoms of Mauritania.

properties.name: Timgad
properties.description: Timgad lies on the northern slopes of the Aurès mountains and was created as a military colony by the Emperor Trajan in AD 100.

properties.name: Kasbah of Algiers
properties.description: The Kasbah is a unique form of medina, or Islamic city. It stands in one of the finest coastal sites on the Mediterranean.

properties.name: Madriu-Perafita-Claror Valley
properties.description: The cultural landscape of Madriu-Perafita-Claror Valley offers a microcosmic perspective of the way people have harvested the resources of the high Pyrenees over millennia.

properties.name: Mbanza Kongo
properties.description: The remains of the capital of one of the largest and most important kingdoms in southern Africa.

properties.name: Antigua Naval Dockyard
properties.description: The only Georgian-era dockyard still in existence in the world.

properties.name: Los Glaciares National Park
properties.description: Contains many large glaciers, of which 47 flow down from the Southern Patagonian Ice Field.

properties.name: Iguazu National Park
properties.description: Home to one of the most spectacular waterfalls in the world.

properties.name: Jesuit Missions of the Guaranis
properties.description: The ruins of São Miguel das Missões in Brazil, and those of San Ignacio Miní, Santa Ana, Nuestra Señora de Loreto and Santa María la Mayor in Argentina.

properties.name: Cueva de las Manos
properties.description: The cave art in Cueva de las Manos (Cave of the Hands) dates from 13,000 to 9,000 years ago.

properties.name: Península Valdés
properties.description: Important nature reserve that has significant whale and seal populations.

properties.name: Ischigualasto / Talampaya Natural Parks
properties.description: These two contiguous parks contain the most complete continental fossil record known from the Triassic Period.

properties.name: Quebrada de Humahuaca
properties.description: The valley shows substantial evidence of its use as a major trade route over the past 10,000 years.

properties.name: Monasteries of Haghpat and Sanahin
properties.description: These two Byzantine monasteries represent the highest flowering of Armenian religious architecture.

properties.name: Cathedral and Churches of Echmiatsin
properties.description: The cathedral and churches of Echmiatsin and the archaeological remains at Zvartnots graphically illustrate the evolution of Armenian central-domed cross-hall type churches.

properties.name: Monastery of Geghard
properties.description: The monastery of Geghard contains a number of churches and tombs, most of them cut into the rock.

properties.name: Great Barrier Reef
properties.description: The world's largest coral reef ecosystem, containing the world's largest collection of coral reefs.

properties.name: Kakadu National Park
properties.description: A unique archaeological and ethnological reserve that has been inhabited continuously for more than 40,000 years.

properties.name: Willandra Lakes Region
properties.description: The fossil remains of a series of lakes and sand formations that date from the Pleistocene era.

properties.name: Tasmanian Wilderness
properties.description: One of the last expanses of temperate rainforest in the world.

properties.name: Lord Howe Island Group
properties.description: An outstanding example of oceanic islands of volcanic origin containing a unique ecosystem.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Vienna
properties.description: The historic centre of Vienna is rich in architectural ensembles, including Baroque castles and gardens.

properties.name: Palace and Gardens of Schönbrunn
properties.description: The summer residence of the Habsburg rulers, an outstanding example of Baroque architecture.

properties.name: Walled City of Baku
properties.description: The Walled City of Baku represents an outstanding example of an historic urban ensemble and architecture.

properties.name: Qal'at al-Bahrain
properties.description: Archaeological site that was once the capital of the Dilmun civilization.

properties.name: Historic Mosque City of Bagerhat
properties.description: Ancient city, formerly known as Khalifatabad, featuring many mosques built in the distinctive Bengal style.

properties.name: Belovezhskaya Pushcha / Białowieża Forest
properties.description: The forest is home to the largest population of European bison.

properties.name: Mir Castle Complex
properties.description: The castle is an exceptional example of a central European fortification.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Bruges
properties.description: Outstanding example of a medieval historic settlement.

properties.name: La Grand-Place, Brussels
properties.description: The central square of Brussels is surrounded by opulent guildhalls and two larger edifices.

properties.name: Belize Barrier Reef Reserve System
properties.description: The largest barrier reef in the northern hemisphere, with offshore atolls, mangrove forests, and coastal lagoons.

properties.name: Royal Palaces of Abomey
properties.description: The palaces of the kings of Abomey are a unique testimony to one of the most powerful kingdoms in Africa.

properties.name: Historic City of Sucre
properties.description: The first capital of Bolivia, with well-preserved colonial architecture.

properties.name: Tiwanaku
properties.description: The ruins of the capital of an important pre-Hispanic empire.

properties.name: Old Bridge Area of the Old City of Mostar
properties.description: The reconstructed Old Bridge and Old City of Mostar is a symbol of reconciliation and coexistence.

properties.name: Tsodilo
properties.description: A site with one of the highest concentrations of rock art in the world.

properties.name: Historic Town of Ouro Preto
properties.description: Founded at the end of the 17th century, Ouro Preto was the focal point of the gold rush and Brazil's golden age.

properties.name: Historic Centre of Salvador de Bahia
properties.description: As the first capital of Brazil, Salvador de Bahia witnessed the blending of European, African and Amerindian cultures.

properties.name: Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Congonhas
properties.description: This sanctuary in Minais Gerais, with its soapstone sculptures by Aleijadinho, represents a unique artistic achievement.

properties.name: Iguaçu National Park
properties.description: The park shares with Iguazu National Park in Argentina one of the world's largest and most impressive waterfalls.

properties.name: Brasilia
properties.description: A landmark in the history of town planning, Brasilia was founded in 1956 and inaugurated as Brazil's capital in 1960.

properties.name: Serra da Capivara National Park
properties.description: Many of the numerous rock shelters in the Serra da Capivara National Park are decorated with cave paintings.

properties.name: Historic Centre of São Luís
properties.description: The late 17th-century core of this historic town, founded by the French and occupied by the Dutch before coming under Portuguese rule.

properties.name: Atlantic Forest South-East Reserves
properties.description: The Atlantic Forest South-East Reserves contain some of the best and most extensive examples of Atlantic forest in Brazil.

properties.name: Discovery Coast Atlantic Forest Reserves
properties.description: The Discovery Coast Atlantic Forest Reserves consist of eight separate protected areas containing the best and largest examples of Atlantic forest in Brazil.

properties.name: Historic Centre of the Town of Diamantina
properties.description: Diamantina shows how explorers of the Brazilian territory, diamond prospectors, and representatives of the Crown were able to adapt European models to an American context.

properties.name: Boyana Church
properties.description: Located on the outskirts of Sofia, this church has frescoes from 1259 that are among the finest examples of medieval art.

properties.name: Madara Rider
properties.description: The Madara Rider, representing a knight triumphing over a lion, is carved into a 100-m-high cliff near the village of Madara.

properties.name: Rock-Hewn Churches of Ivanovo
properties.description: In the valley of the Roussenski Lom River, a complex of rock-hewn churches, chapels, monasteries and cells developed in the Middle Ages.

properties.name: Thracian Tomb of Kazanlak
properties.description: This tomb dates from the Hellenistic period, around the end of the 4th century BC. It is decorated with unique murals.

properties.name: Ancient City of Nessebar
properties.description: Originally a Thracian settlement, the peninsula was colonized by the Greeks and later became an important Byzantine town.

properties.name: Pirin National Park
properties.description: The mountain scenery of Pirin National Park is dotted with over 70 glacial lakes and the oldest tree in Bulgaria.

properties.name: Rila Monastery
properties.description: Founded in the 10th century, the Rila Monastery is regarded as one of Bulgaria's most important cultural, historical and architectural monuments.

properties.name: Srebarna Nature Reserve
properties.description: The Srebarna Nature Reserve is a freshwater lake adjacent to the Danube and extending over 600 ha.

properties.name: Thracian Tomb of Sveshtari
properties.description: Discovered in 1982 near the village of Sveshtari, this 3rd-century BC Thracian tomb reflects the fundamental structural principles of Thracian cult buildings.

properties.name: Ruins of Loropéni
properties.description: The ruins of Loropéni are the best preserved of ten fortresses in the Lobi area and are part of a larger group of 100 stone enclosures.
